mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Dictyodendrillidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and physical disturbances. This is inferred from the general biology of sponges.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and other chemical cues in the water. This is inferred from the general biology of sponges.

photoreception.notes: It is unknown if Dictyodendrillidae have photoreceptors.
